title: Medieval English Terms
description: Journey back to the Middle Ages with these words from medieval England (5th-15th century)

questions.question: In medieval England, what was a 'sennight'?
options: A period of seven nights (one week)

questions.question: What was a 'bailey' in medieval architecture?
options: The enclosed courtyard of a castle

questions.question: What did 'tithe' mean in medieval times?
options: A one-tenth tax paid to the church

questions.question: In medieval society, what was a 'villein'?
options: A feudal tenant bound to the lord's land

questions.question: What was a 'palfrey' in the Middle Ages?
options: A light riding horse for everyday travel

questions.question: What did 'hauberk' refer to in medieval times?
options: A type of coat of mail armor

questions.question: In medieval England, what was a 'minstrel'?
What was 'mead' in the medieval period?
options: An alcoholic drink made from fermented honey

questions.question: What did the medieval term 'fortnight' mean?
options: A period of fourteen nights (two weeks)

questions.question: In medieval England, what was a 'reeve'?
options: A heavy rope used in construction
An official who managed an estate or district

questions.question: What was a 'destrier' in the Middle Ages?
What did 'garderobe' mean in a medieval castle?
In medieval terms, what was a 'guild'?
options: An association of craftsmen or merchants

questions.question: What was a 'trebuchet' in the Middle Ages?
options: A siege engine for hurling projectiles

questions.question: What did 'fief' mean in the medieval feudal system?
options: An estate of land granted by a lord
